entries.content: User wants to redesign system message UI - currently too large and breaks design consistency. Need to match header-dropdown styling: smaller icon, smaller headline, metallic/glassmorphism theme with backdrop-blur

User wants system messages to match header-dropdown color scheme - dark metallic theme with subtle borders, NOT the current bright orange/brown/colored backgrounds. Need to replace the colored gradients with metallic dark backgrounds.

User wants to replace emoji icon (ðŸš«) in system messages with SVG icon (stop.svg / shield-x). Currently using emojis directly in MessageTypeConfig. System has window.ICONS auto-loading from assets/icons with IconLoader for data-icon attributes. Need to determine best approach: use window.ICONS directly or data-icon pattern.

Successfully replaced system message refusal emoji icon (ðŸš«) with SVG icon (ui-icons/stop.svg) using data-icon pattern. Implementation: MessageTypeConfig uses 'ui-icons/stop', MessageBuilder auto-detects icon type (emoji vs SVG path), CSS handles both span and img elements, MessageInjector calls IconLoader.init() after injection.
